availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: New York soldier. New York native. Graduate of the U.S. Military Academy in 1833. Served in the 1st U.S. Artillery as a brevet second lieutenant from July 1, 1833 to October 1, 1833. Resigned October 1, 1833. Surveyor of New York City. Railroad engineer in Massachusetts. Railroad engineer in New York. Railroad engineer in Panama. Railroad engineer in Illinois from 1849 to 1855. Railroad engineer in Tehuantepec, Oaxaca, Mexico, in 1859. Served in the 15th U.S. Infantry (U.S.A) as a major from May 14, 1861 to May 6, 1864. Served as assistant provost-marshal for Kentucky. Served in the 6th U.S. Infantry (U.S.A.) as lieutenant colonel from May 6, 1864 through December 31, 1865. Subsequently brevetted to colonel and Brigadier General.
